subSections.title: Glyph origin
Etymology
subSections.text: Related to {{cog|tai-pro|*ʰlaːjᴬ||many, much}}, whence {{cog|th|หลาย||many}}.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text:
{{zh-pron
|m=duō,duó
|m_note=duó - colloquial variant (“so, how, what”)
|m-s=do1
|c=do1,doe1
|c_note=doe1 - colloquial variant (“few”)
|c-t=o1
|h=pfs=tô
|mb=duói/dó̤/do̿
|mb_note=duói - vernacular; dó - literary; do̿ - limited (e.g. {{zh-l|*多謝}})
|md=dŏ̤
|mn=xm,zz,tw:to/qz:to͘
|mn-t=do1
|w=1tu
|mc=y
|oc=y
|ma=y
|cat=a,adv,v
}}

subSections.title: Definitions
Usage notes
subSections.text:
* {{sense|over, more than}} When the number is smaller or equal to 10, {{lang|zh|多}} can be put after the measure word. If it is bigger than ten, {{lang|zh|多}} has to be put before the measure word.
* {{sense|more}} Placing {{lang|zh|多}} after the verb is correct but it is less natural than placing it before.
